<h3 class="doctest-section-pyname"></h3>

Log streams yield logical log entries given by header pattern. Consider the
following log file:

<pre class="docttest-data">
2005-11-22 12:00:00,346 DEBUG A B
2005-11-22 12:00:00,378 DEBUG D E
F G
H I
20051122 12:00:00,123
 2005-11-22 12:00:00,378
2005-11-22 12:15:01,300 DEBUG J K
L M 2005-11-22 12:15:01,300
N O P
</pre>
<i>tests/data/test-entry.log</i>

Each entry is not a line but all data following the default log
header

<pre class="doctest-example">

>>> from loggrok.log import LogStream
>>> log = LogStream(filename)
>>> for entry in log:
...     print '-' * 10
...     print str(entry)[:-1]
...
----------
A B
----------
D E
F G
H I
20051122 12:00:00,123
 2005-11-22 12:00:00,378
----------
J K
L M 2005-11-22 12:15:01,300
N O P

</pre>
